perturbation.original_text:
e. “Net Revenue” shall mean gross receipts collected by Company or Reseller from the distribution of Company
Products, [less third party commissions, equipment sales, delivery costs, taxes, refunds, and credits.
perturbation.changed_text:
e. “Net Revenue” shall mean gross receipts collected by Company or Reseller from the distribution of Company
Products, [less third party commissions and taxes.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of 'Net Revenue' deducts 'equipment sales, delivery costs, refunds, and credits' from gross receipts. The modified version omits these deductions. This creates ambiguity, as it is unclear whether these items should be deducted when calculating 'Net Revenue' for determining commissions, potentially leading to disputes.

perturbation.original_text:
Registered Referral:


·
25% of Net Revenue (as defined in Section 1e.) with a COMPANY-RESELLER AGREED UPON SALE PRICE in writing,
the case of COMPANY’s software products. The Company’s Telecom Services will be agreed upon on a case-by-case
basis in writing.
perturbation.changed_text:
Registered Referral:


·
25% of Net Revenue (as defined in Section 1e.) with a COMPANY-RESELLER AGREED UPON SALE PRICE in writing,
the case of COMPANY’s software products. The Company’s Telecom Services will be 20% of Net Revenue.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that Telecom Services commission will be agreed upon a case-by-case basis. The changed text sets a commission of 20% of Net Revenue. This creates an in-text contradiction and enforcement uncertainty, as it is now unclear whether the case-by-case agreement or the set percentage applies.

perturbation.original_text: Marketing Materials: Electronic and print copies of existing marketing material as needed.
perturbation.changed_text: Marketing Materials: Electronic copies of existing marketing material only.
perturbation.explanation: Originally the agreement stated that both electronic and print copies of marketing materials will be provided to the reseller as needed. The modified term now states that only electronic copies of existing marketing materials are to be provided. This creates ambiguity, because it is now unclear if the company is still obligated to provide any physical print copies of marketing materials.
